<title level="1" pfs="">[Virulak Necromancer](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2057)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

Virulak necromancers are often intrigued by the interplay between poison and undeath, testing toxins on their dead flesh or, more commonly, on hapless living victims. This virulak necromancer was once a sorcerer but now considers their bloodline irrelevant.

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Undead](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13)): DC 28

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 26

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 23
</column>

</column>

<column gap="medium">
<image src="/images/Monsters/Virulak_Necromancer.png" />
</column>

</row>

<title level="2" right="Creature 7">[Virulak Necromancer](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2057)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Rare" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=137" />
<trait label="NE" url="/Rules.aspx?ID=95" />
<trait label="Medium" />
<trait label="Undead" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=160" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Pathfinder #182: Graveclaw](/Sources.aspx?ID=143) pg. 87

**Perception** +13; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12)

**Languages**
[Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Necril](/Languages.aspx?ID=20)

**Skills**
[Arcana](/Skills.aspx?ID=2) +15, [Crafting](/Skills.aspx?ID=4) +15, [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=6) +17, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +17, [Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13) +13

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +4

**Dex** +0

**Con** +4

**Int** +2

**Wis** +2

**Cha** +6
</row>

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 24 

**Fort** +15 

**Ref** +12 

**Will** +18 

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**HP** 115
([negative healing](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=42))

</row>

**Immunities**
[death](/Traits.aspx?ID=40) effects, [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=46), [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=28), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126), [unconscious](/Conditions.aspx?ID=38)

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 25 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
claw +18 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170)),
**Damage** 2d8+6 slashing plus undead virulence

**Arcane Spontaneous Spells** DC 25, attack +17
- **Cantrips (4th)**
[Chill Touch](/Spells.aspx?ID=35), [Electric Arc](/Spells.aspx?ID=97), [Mage Hand](/Spells.aspx?ID=177), [Read Aura](/Spells.aspx?ID=246), [Shield](/Spells.aspx?ID=280)
- **1st**
[Grim Tendrils](/Spells.aspx?ID=141), [Ray of Enfeeblement](/Spells.aspx?ID=244), [True Strike](/Spells.aspx?ID=345) (4 slots)
- **2nd**
[False Life](/Spells.aspx?ID=108), [Gentle Repose](/Spells.aspx?ID=131), [Spectral Hand](/Spells.aspx?ID=295) (4 slots)
- **3rd**
[Bind Undead](/Spells.aspx?ID=22), [Blindness](/Spells.aspx?ID=26), [Vampiric Touch](/Spells.aspx?ID=354) (4 slots)
- **4th**
[Enervation](/Spells.aspx?ID=687), [Vampiric Maiden](/Spells.aspx?ID=725) (3 slots)

**Uncanny Necromancy**   The virulak necromancer can freely heighten [_false life_](/Spells.aspx?ID=108), [_grim tendrils_](/Spells.aspx?ID=141), and [_vampiric touch_](/Spells.aspx?ID=354) to any level they can cast without knowing them at higher levels.

**Undead Virulence**  ([Poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126), [Virulent](/Traits.aspx?ID=162)) **Saving Throw** DC 25 Fortitude; **Maximum Duration** 6 rounds; **Stage 1** 2d8 poison damage (1 round); **Stage 2** 3d8 poison damage (1 round); **Stage 3** 4d8 poison damage (1 round)

**Venomous Gaze** <actions string="Two Actions" /> ([Concentrate](/Traits.aspx?ID=32), [Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Necromancy](/Traits.aspx?ID=117), [Poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126), [Visual](/Traits.aspx?ID=163)) The virulak locks its gaze on a single creature within 30 feet. The target is exposed to the virulak's undead virulence.

</column>

<aside>
<title level="2" noclass="true" icon="/images/Icons/Sidebar_2_AdditionalLore.png">Necropoisons</title>

Many virulak necromancers seek to find or recreate the fabled “necropoisons,” or toxins that work on undead despite their immunity to poison. Rumored to be a magical combination of positive energy and venom from magical creatures, necropoisons have eluded even the most talented virulaks—so far.
</aside>

<document level="2" id="creature-family-318" />
